intro: Scordium officinale, commonly known as the common scordium, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. Its small white or yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
